comments.commentBody:
Why can't Democrats focus like a laser beam on the economy like Bill Clinton did? How about addressing the following issues:

1) Outsourcing of U.S. manufacturing jobs to China
2) Americans sending their money to the Middle East to pay for oil for their cars
3) Reducing spending to curb the deficit
4) Pushing now for the permanent extension of the Bush tax cuts for 98% of Americans who aren't rich
5) Eliminating all congressional pensions and cutting the salaries of every member of Congress in half immediately - to symbolically show that Congress "gets it" that middle America is bleeding economically.

If the Democrats pushed these issues, they can turn around the doom and gloom. If they continue being a "Babel" of numerous voices, there is a big Red hurricane forming off the coast that will wipe them out in November.

This is what makes GOP hubris about November so hilarious:

¶ There is no recovery, and there won't be one until the complete disappearance of the threat of any misguided, uninformed, counterproductive policies like the ones that got us into this mess.

¶ In case my comment went right over your head, here it is in plain English: our world does not want any American conservatives anywhere near any market, government office or anywhere else they can do the kind of damage we have seen in the last 30 or so years.

¶ American Republicans have the kiss of death for sensible, sustainable growth in concert with protective, thoughtful regulation of markets and their assets.

¶ Until Republican misrule is vanquished, our world will founder on the rocks of utterly decimated financial systems.

The Democrats should fear the voters over the economy.  This economy was caused by those Democrats.  They have controlled Congress since 2006, and the Presidency since 2008.  The Democrats might want to avoid responsibility, but most voters will rightly hold them accountable this November.

As a Democrat, I say they deserve to lose this election and badly. They learnt nothing from 1994. Just like then, not only did they control both the congress and the senate, but also the White House, yet they managed to accomplish virtually nothing. They spent all the capital the president claimed he had on a health care bill they now refuse to defend and campaign on. Even with the economy this bad, if they had had the guts to pass many major bills that were simply left to die, they would be in a better position today.

In fact it seems when the Democrats gain power all they can agree on is they can do nothing. When the Republicans briefly had the same control, they were united, passed bills and confirmed judges that have forever changed America. If the Democrats with an absolute majority in congress, a filibuster proof majority in the senate and a popular president in the White House can't pass any bills or change America, they don't deserve to stay in power. Good riddance.

The latest incarnation democrats have proved to be morally corrupt and decadent in the style of Rome.  I also warn the Republicans who will be taking over this ship of state that is sinking lower and lower that they had better beware.  Their first order of business is to de-fund the monstrosity known as "Obamacare".  If they do not do this they will be next.

This whole cycle is just amazing.  The Democrats allowed the Republicans to destroy our economy during the Bush administration.  Now that the Democrats wound up in office, they are taking the fall for the failed economy.  It's hard to know whether to call it cupidity or stupidity.  Either way, we suffer and the politicians just keep on keepin' on.

It is a shame that politicians only think of regular people when Election Day nears and their own jobs are on the line. Hello? Incidentally, we are at the beginning of a Great Depression. After exporting jobs, worrying about illegal immigrant rights, giving bailouts, not taking action when even profitable companies gleefully "lay off" workers while preaching "family values"- oh, gee, the voters are upset? Lay off Congress- the whole bunch- we need a new system of government. This one is clearly too corrupt to work any longer.

This is not about politics, it's about policy. Saving public sector jobs by increasing taxes on the private sector is a doomed agenda. It does not lead to higher payrolls in the private sector to fund public sector jobs.

The current administration has it backwards and Obama is at the heart of the policy, along with Reid and Pelosi in tow. I can only hope the opposition party will turn this around if elected, and get things back into the right cause and effect scenario.

Too late. People expect miracles, and it isn't going to happen.
It will take time and investment into clean energy and higher education, and the party of no will not let that happen.

Small business loans are a good starter. Credit has dried up as the banksters keep all our deposits to make their balance sheets look less fraudulent. Meanwhile, the small businesses that could readily hire are frozen for want of their usual credit lines. The republicants are pro-business, but only corporate giants so lately given super-personhood. So looking good to the smalls will garner votes come November. (It's already September, remember. If it is to be, let it be now.)
Democrats are like spoiled, immature children who are convinced they never have to pay for their mistakes.  This fall, the voters will be showing the Democrats some needed adult supervision.

I run a small business. A really small business. And while I'm doing fine, it's certainly not thanks to anything this current POTUS or Congress did. Quite the contrary. Now I hear about the administration wanting to help small business...that is, if they knew how, knew anything about us. Too late to play catch-up, Dems!
it is not the economy, silly. It is the leadership.

"Democrats say the list of stimulus ideas is mostly tax cuts because spending proposals would have no chance of Republican support."

That says it all about the timid and cowardly Democrats. The voters elect them because they don't support the Republican policies and then the Democrats push Republican policies because that is all the Republicans will allow them to do.

Obama has even appointed Republicans to his deficit commission so they can instruct the Democrats on how to gut Social Security. I apologize America. I voted for Obama with hope for change and all we got was an articulate Sarah Palin.

campaigner in chief.
meh.
So this candidate has money woes and foreclosure in her background? And here I thought all Repub candidates wiped with 100 dollar bills.
As usual, a lot of "what they are against" but not much in the department of what they will do to get us out of this mess.
Maybe Fiorina will just outsource the entire state.
Anybody else REALLY like the way the lineup clicks with Gardner and Granderson at the top of the order?

Johan, Jose Reyes, David Wright, Carlos Beltran haven't panned out. Hurt all the time- always some excuse for not performing in the clutch. Take it to the bank they will never get it done in an important situation. The Phillies and Braves own the Mets and everybody involved knows it- the Mets are beaten before they even take the field. No need to analyze anymore- these Mets are L-O-S-E-R-S.

Marco #47:

You are right. I just haven't had time to think things through recently, being up to the neck at work... Thank you.

The positive tone in the reviews here is justified; it is a good - but not great - place. Some negative points that are worth noting are:

1. My room was a good size, but a bit dark and gloomy, with a very small window.
2. The breakfast was pretty basic and was exactly the same each day, with instant coffee, and nothing very Turkish - the same cheese-and-cold-meat continental breakfast that seems to be offered across Europe.
3. You are near restaurants but some of them have loud live music and the double-glazed window doesn't keep much of the noise out. Earplugs are highly recommended.

However the positives are all good:

1. You're located exactly where you want to be: a lot of the key sights and the main public transport routes are all very close by. The surrounding streets offer places to eat.
2. The rooms are good sized, clean and comfortable. None of the "ususal suspects" here - hot water was good and limitless, the bed was comfortable, the place was clean and modern, the furniture basic but not shabby.
3. The staff are friendly, excellent english speakers, they can arrange tours and other services if you ask them to.
4. Internet connectivity - wifi and a PC in the lobby.

It is true that taxi drivers can't find it. It is just around the corner from the Hippodrome (which they can find) but it's a bit hard to get an accurate map and Google Maps seems to have trouble finding it too. Expect to pay about 45 TL lire for a taxi ride from Attaturk airport by the time the driver goes up a couple of wrong streets...
www.ladydianahotel.com
Honest, hon, he's just a nudist who came in to use the phone...well, he's got no pockets to carry a cellphone..
My dog misplaced it in his bedroom.

When I was 18 and my sister 16, we wanted to go to the midnight showing of Dawn of the Dead - it was a big deal at the time.

However, the theater would not let my sister in without a parent.

We left and came back 15 minutes later with a guy who was her "husband".
